definitions.definition: push a sharp or pointed object into or through (something).
examples: he stuck his fork into the sausage
synonyms: plunge "he stuck his fork into the sausage"

definitions.definition: fix something on (a point or pointed object).
examples: stick the balls of wool on knitting needles

definitions.definition: (of a pointed object) be or remain fixed with its point embedded in (something).
examples: there was a slim rod sticking into the ground beside me

definitions.definition: insert, thrust, or push.
examples: past tense: sticked; past participle: sticked

definitions.definition: protrude or extend in a certain direction.
examples: his front teeth stick out
synonyms: show up; informalstick/stand out like a sore thumb "they stuck out in their strange clothes"

definitions.definition: put somewhere, typically in a quick or careless way.
examples: just stick that sandwich on my desk
synonyms: plunk "just stick that sandwich on my desk"

definitions.definition: used to express angry dismissal of a particular thing.
examples: he told them they could stick the job—he didn't want it anyway

definitions.definition: cause to incur an expense or loss.
examples: she stuck me for all of last month's rent

definitions.definition: stab or pierce with a sharp object.
examples: he screamed like a stuck pig
synonyms: stab "the bristles stuck into her skin"

definitions.definition: adhere or cling to a substance or surface.
examples: the plastic seats stuck to my skin
synonyms: be glued "the cup stuck to its saucer"

definitions.definition: fasten or cause to adhere to an object or surface.
examples: she stuck the stamp on the envelope

definitions.definition: be or become fixed or jammed in one place as a result of an obstruction.
examples: he drove into a bog, where his wheels stuck fast
synonyms: become embedded "the wheels stuck in the mud"

definitions.definition: remain in a static condition; fail to progress.
examples: he lost a lot of weight but had stuck at 210 pounds

definitions.definition: be or become convincing, established, or regarded as valid.
examples: the authorities couldn't make the charges stick
synonyms: burn More"that sticks in his mind"be upheld
be believed; informalhold water "the charges won't stick"

definitions.definition: (in blackjack and similar card games) decline to add to one's hand.
be fixed in a particular position or unable to move or be moved.
examples: Sara tried to open the window but it was stuck

definitions.definition: be unable to progress with a task or find the answer or solution to something.
examples: I'm doing the crossword and I'm stuck

definitions.definition: be or remain in a specified place or situation, typically one perceived as tedious or unpleasant.
examples: I don't want to be stuck in an office all my life

definitions.definition: be at a loss for or in need of.
examples: I'm not usually stuck for words

definitions.definition: be unable to get rid of or escape from.
examples: like it or not, she and Grant were stuck with each other
synonyms: made responsible for "she's always getting stuck with the neighbors' kids"

definitions.definition: be infatuated with.
examples: he's too good for Jenny, even though she's so stuck on him
synonyms: carrying a torch for "no one knew that Kit was stuck on his brother's wife"

definitions.definition: accept or tolerate (an unpleasant or unwelcome person or situation).
examples: I can't stick Geoffrey—he's a real old misery

definitions.definition: put up with or persevere with something difficult or disagreeable.
examples: put up with it, grin and bear it, keep at it, keep going, stay with it, see it through; Morepersevere, persist, carry on, struggle on; informalhang in there, soldier on, tough it out, nail one's colors to the mast "I think I can stick it out for another two weeks"Morepersevere, persist, carry on, struggle on; hang in there, soldier on, tough it out, nail one's colors to the mast I think I can stick it out for another two weeks
